info.description: APIs to retrieve and manage direct debits and mandates collection details of customers or accounts. Direct debits are typically used for recurring payments, such as credit card and utility bills, where the payment amounts vary from one payment to another.
info.title: Direct Debits Management

get.description: Retrieves the list of direct debits for specific account

parameters.name: directDebitId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the direct debit mandate.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

get.summary: Retrieves the debtor mandate details for the customer/account
get.description: Retrieves the details from debtor mandate such as scheme, payment type, creditor information and latest collection details of the mandates of a customer or an account provided

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

put.summary: Updates debtor direct debit mandate details
put.description: Updates the existing debtor mandate with details such as scheme, creditor information, reason for amendments and latest collection details of the mandates.

parameters.name: directDebitId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the direct debit mandate.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

put.summary: Cancel the specified inward debtor direct debit mandates
put.description: Updates the existing debtor mandate with status as cancelled along with the status change reasons.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

page_size.description: The total number of records per page

page_start.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

total_size.description: The total number of records present

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request

directDebitId.description: The unique identifier of the direct debit mandate.

customerMnemonic.description: Specifies an alternative easy means of referencing the Customer

creditAccountId.description: Credit account identifier of the payment or transaction

creditorName.description: Name or short title of the credit account

sortCode.description: Contains bank sort code or iban branch identifier for the account

displayName.description: Contains the name used for display or enrichment purposes

direction.description: Indicates the direction of the Direct debit claim for which mandate is received. The claim can be 'Outward' i.e. Claim is sent to the other bank or 'Inward'  i.e. other bank submit their claim to debit our customer's account.

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

standAloneDdi.description: Defines whether the direct debit mandate is for stand-alone purpose i.e. one-off instruction

status.description: The status of the early maturity request

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

frequency.description: Specifies the frequency in which the payment application(periodic payments) execute the payment instruction.

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

nextPaymentDate.description: Indicates next payment date for the contract

currencyName.description: The name that is displayed for the currency

accountName.description: Display name or short name of the account specified.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

code.description: The identifier of the error message
The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message for bad requests

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

message.description: The actual t24 error message caused by server

type.description: The identifier of error type: System

code.description: The code related to override message.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

override.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

displayName.description: Contains the name used for display or enrichment purposes

direction.description: Indicates the direction of the Direct debit claim for which mandate is received. The claim can be 'Outward' i.e. Claim is sent to the other bank or 'Inward'  i.e. other bank submit their claim to debit our customer's account.

parameterId.description: Identifies the record key of a Parameter table,that acts as a key to access the information specific to them. This holds system or a company as its value.

sortCode.description: Contains bank sort code or iban branch identifier for the account

requestType.description: This field will have the value as INTERNAL/EXTERNAL type of record

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

currencyMarket.description: Identifies the currency market to be used to get the correct exchange and revaluation rates to be applied to each currency

creditAccountName.description: Account name details of the creditor

creditAccountId.description: Credit account identifier of the payment or transaction

directDebitStatus.description: The status of direct debit mandate i.e. New, Advised, Hold, Active, Available, Returned or Cancelled. Only when the status is Active or Available, the instruction will be sent out for collecting funds

standaloneAmount.description: The amount of the stand-alone direct debit

frequency.description: Specifies the frequency in which the payment application(periodic payments) execute the payment instruction.

terminationDate.description: This is the termination date of recurring direct debit

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

claimId.description: Reference id to track claim record

direction.description: Indicates the direction of the Direct debit claim for which mandate is received. The claim can be 'Outward' i.e. Claim is sent to the other bank or 'Inward'  i.e. other bank submit their claim to debit our customer's account.

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

valueDate.description: Indicates the value date on which the underlying accounting entry is to be given value (for interest purposes)

claimStatus.description: Status update of the claim records

creditorAddresses.description: Address of the creditor or beneficiary account

creditorAddress.description: Address of the creditor or beneficiary account

mandateId.description: Contains the mandatory SEPA(Single Euro Payment Area) payment identifier from the transaction

mandateScheme.description: The Payment scheme and service level under which the mandate can be used (e.g SEPA*CORE)

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

accountName.description: Display name or short name of the account specified.

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

creditorReference.description: Creditor Reference provided in the transaction

creditorName.description: Name or short title of the credit account

ultimateCreditorCountry.description: It specifies the Country of Ultimate creditor of payment

ultimateCreditor.description: Contains the actual creditor account number

creditAccountIBAN.description: Indicates the IBAN of the credit account

executionDate.description: Date on which the transaction or payment gets processed, i.e. the processing date of the transaction.

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

mandateSigningDate.description: The date when the mandate has been signed by the Debtor

remittanceInformation.description: Indicates the remittance information that is supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.

structuredCreditorReference.description: Contains description of the credit account reference

structuredCommunicationCode.description: Creditor reference in a coded form i.e - RADM (RemittanceAdviceMessage) - RPIN (RelatedPaymentInstruction) - FXDR (ForeignExchangeDealReference) - DISP (DispatchAdvice) - PUOR (PurchaseOrder) - SCOR (StructuredCommunicationReference)

mandateType.description: Indicates how the  Mandate was registered (e.g.  automatically, paper, electronic)

terminationDate.description: This is the termination date of recurring direct debit

maximumCollections.description: Indicates the maximum number of collections that can be posted under the direct debit within the defined period of time

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

frequency.description: Specifies the frequency in which the payment application(periodic payments) execute the payment instruction.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

periodStartDate.description: Indicates the start date of a period over which the transaction or payment can be cycled based on the frequency

periodEndDate.description: Indicates the end date of a period over which the transaction or payment can be cycled based on the frequency

successfulCollections.description: Indicates the number of direct debit collections posted on the account in current frequency cycle

creditorReference.description: Creditor Reference provided in the transaction

creditorName.description: Name or short title of the credit account

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

terminationDate.description: This is the termination date of recurring direct debit

maximumCollections.description: Indicates the maximum number of collections that can be posted under the direct debit within the defined period of time

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

frequency.description: Specifies the frequency in which the payment application(periodic payments) execute the payment instruction.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

mandateAmendmentReasonCode.description: Contains the reason code for amending the eMandate. Eg. MD16

creditorName.description: Name or short title of the credit account

cancelReason.description: Contains the reason for which the payment is cancelled.

directDebitStatus.description: The status of direct debit mandate i.e. New, Advised, Hold, Active, Available, Returned or Cancelled. Only when the status is Active or Available, the instruction will be sent out for collecting funds
